description: The underlying cause of the issue described pertains to difficulties encountered during the installation of patches on servers, specifically in Windows Server 2022. The user indicates that the updates fail to install through standard methods and that manual installation via the Microsoft Update Catalog is necessary to resolve the issue. This situation suggests a potential misconfiguration in the Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) setup or an error in the automatic update process, leading to subsequent installation failures. When installing manually, the user finds that all subsequent updates work correctly, indicating that a successful patch installation resets the update process. This scenario points to an issue where the server does not properly manage patch dependencies or update states, hindering the automatic deployment of updates thereafter.
